description:
Acanthochromis polyacanthus, commonly known as the spiny chromis or spiny damselfish, is a species of marine fish belonging to the family Pomacentridae. It is a small, colorful damselfish found in the Indo-Pacific region, inhabiting coral reefs and associated reef environments.

The spiny chromis is characterized by its distinctive spiny dorsal and anal fins, which are capable of delivering a painful sting when handled. Its body is typically olive-brown or gray in color, with bright blue or yellow markings on the fins and head. The species is known for its unique parental care behavior, where the male and female work together to protect and care for their offspring.

Acanthochromis polyacanthus is an important component of coral reef ecosystems, playing a role in the overall biodiversity and functioning of these diverse marine habitats. It is of interest to both marine biologists and aquarium enthusiasts due to its unique behavioral and morphological adaptations.
